image.altText: A 70-year-old woman with shoulder length brown hair sitting down.

props.synopsis: Five teenagers have been charged as police continue to investigate the stabbing death of a 70-year-old grandmother at a Redbank Plains shopping centre.

title.children: Five teenagers charged after grandmother stabbed to death at shopping centre west of Brisbane

image.altText: Photo of King Charles looking serious

props.synopsis: The King had been treated in hospital last month for a benign prostate condition, but during the stay in hospital, the palace said "a separate issue of concern was noted". The 75-year-old has begun treatment and will stand down from public-facing duties while that continues.

title.children: King Charles III has commenced treatment for cancer, palace reveals

image.altText: A car drives along a beach-side road lined with shops.

props.synopsis: For many fed-up Australians struggling to afford record-high rents, short-term rentals like Airbnbs are an easy scapegoat. But is that the reality? The answer, just like the problem, isn't straightforward.

title.children: The town where local workers live in hotels and caravans, and tourists stay in the houses

props.synopsis: Confused about how much you'll actually be getting back across all three stages of the tax cuts?Â Exclusive new data reveals how much you need to earn to reap the biggest percentage return if the revised tax cuts are passed into law.

title.children: This is the magic income that gives you the biggest tax cut across all three stages of the revised tax plan

image.altText: Dutton, Turnbull and Morrison.

props.synopsis: Senior Liberals lift the lid on the "week of madness" that consumed Malcolm Turnbull's prime ministership and elevated an unexpected contender to the top job.

title.children: Turnbullâs old colleagues have laid out in gobsmacking detail how they brought him down

image.altText: A person watches on as the Warragamba Dam spillway is seen outflowing in november 27 2021

props.synopsis: The trajectory of ex-Tropical Cyclone Kirrily will ensure the southern portion of Warragamba's catchment receives sufficient rain to send the dam level over 100 per cent in the coming days.

title.children: Sydney's Warragamba Dam set to spill as ex-Tropical Cyclone Kirrily brings heaviest rain in decades

image.altText: U.S. President Joe Biden pauses during a meeting with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

props.synopsis: Biden's executive order authorising sanctions on four violent Israeli settler leaders will probably be meaningless: settlers know they have virtual immunity for such actions, writes John Lyons.

title.children: Joe Biden's executive order against four Israeli settlers will probably be meaningless. I've seen why up close

image.altText: Two smiling women in US military uniform shake the hand of an Indigenous toddler wearing cultural face paint

props.synopsis: A relationship that's built on mutual respect between Australian soldiers, US Marines and traditional owners is empowering the people of Timber Creek and ensuring the protection of their cultural history.

title.children: The unlikely alliance transforming Timber Creek

image.altText: Birds fly out the front of Parliament House

props.synopsis: "Why should well-heeled corporate types get to spend time at a table with a minister ... when a normal voter would not even get an audience?" a retired teacher asked the inquiry. That's a question we'd all like an answer to, writes Linton Besser.

title.children: Why political parties don't want you to know where their campaign donations are coming from

image.altText: A photo of a Chinese-Australian man Yang Hengjun, sitting on an outside table, wearing a navy polo shirt with a red collar.

props.synopsis: The writer and democracy activist has been imprisoned since 2019 on charges of spying, which he denies. Foreign Minister Penny Wong called the court's decision "harrowing and appalling", although his death penalty can be converted to a life sentence after two years of good behaviour.

title.children: Chinese ambassador to explain 'appalling' death sentence for Australian Yang Hengjun

image.altText: A two frame image, showing an orange rock-like sponge close-up and two old men holding the same sponges

props.synopsis: An analysis of sea sponge skeletons from the Caribbean suggests Earth has already hit 1.7 degrees and could be 2C warmer than before industrialisation in the next six years, but not all scientists are convinced.

title.children: Sea sponge study suggests Earth has already surpassed 1.5C of warming

image.altText: Artist impression of retirement village being built trackside in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: St Hilliers is placed into voluntary administration as work halts on its developments around Australia, including major projects in Newcastle, the Central Coast and Brisbane.

title.children: Construction giant calls in administrators leaving 21 multimillion-dollar developments dangling

image.altText: Group of city workers walking on street

props.synopsis: Leaving the cash rate unchanged today is all but a foregone conclusion for the RBA. Behind closed doors, you can't help but wonder if November's rate hike was a mistake as the economy cools, writes Ian Verrender.

title.children: The RBA is all but guaranteed to keep rates on hold, but the cost of living crisis could still worsen

image.altText: The silhouette of a child sitting on a bed with an adult sitting alongside them.

props.synopsis: State care failings are being investigated following a 12-year-old girl being charged with murder. 125 reports alleging abuse in the care system have been made to the commissioner of children and young people in the past nine months.

title.children: 'Significant concerns': Inquiry launched into state care of 12-year-old accused of murder

image.altText: Ambulance with emergency lights on in city street.

props.synopsis: A man still grieving the loss of his mother in January says Tasmanian ambulance paramedics had to ask him to provide blankets and pillows to transport her safely and comfortably â meanwhile, an inquiry into the service hears apologies over long wait times and inadequate care.

title.children: Woman's husband administered morphine while waiting for ambulance

image.altText: A premature baby's hand holds the fingers of an adult hand.

props.synopsis: A social worker tells an inquest into the death of a baby boy, 11 days after he was discharged from a north Queensland hospital, that she did not report her concerns about his parents to theÂ Department of Child Safety.

title.children: Inquest hears social worker doubted parents could care for premature baby at home, but did not report concerns

image.altText: Cliffs meet the waters edge in an arid setting

props.synopsis: Wreckage of the four-wheel-drive, which was driven off a steep cliff at a remote beach in the early hours of Sunday morning, will be closely examined by police.

title.children: 'Everybody is feeling it': 4WD plunges off steep cliff claiming two young lives

image.altText: A person in a red jacket is knee-deep in flood waters walking towards a car.

props.synopsis: The National Weather Service is warning the storm could bring heavy rain, snow and coastal flooding to the golden state.

title.children: Nearly 700,000 without power, parts of southern California in state of emergency as storm escalates

image.altText: Young men and women cover their faces as tear gas spreads through a crowd of people and cars.

props.synopsis: President Macky Sall's unprecedented announcement on Saturday that he would move to delay the Senegal's election pitched the West African nation into uncharted constitutional waters.

title.children: Senegalese government tear-gasses protesters, cuts off internet ahead of vote to delay election

image.altText: A white woman with brown hair in a bun crossing her arms and looking sideways.

props.synopsis: Questions remain about how long a mould infestation discovered at Broken Hill's Willyama High School last monthÂ has been growing, and whether the health of children and staff has been compromised.

title.children: Families in dark on whether children were exposed before toxic mould outbreak closed high school

image.altText: A livestock vessel docked off the coast

props.synopsis: About 16,000 livestock will stay stranded on a ship in Perth after the federal agriculture department forbid them from being re-exported.

title.children: Agriculture department forbids 16,000 livestock stranded in Perth being re-exported to Israel

image.altText: Russell Vale mine Wollongong

props.synopsis: The troubled Russell Vale Colliery, located in the northern Illawarra region of New South Wales, has notified its workforce of its impending closure.Â

title.children: Coal mine to close in Wollongong, impacting more than 100 workers

image.altText: The outside of the McDonald's restaurant in Broome, WA

props.synopsis: A man found guilty of encouraging girlsÂ as young as seven to engage in sexual behaviour at a Broome McDonald's is granted bail so a psychological assessment can take place beforeÂ his sentencing.

title.children: Man granted bail despite being found guilty of trying to lure children into McDonald's toilet

image.altText: an outside shot of the beach road hotel in bondi

props.synopsis: On Monday, a Sydney court was told the complainant travelled interstateÂ after the alleged assault in a Bondi hotel cubicle to visit her fiance's family and shop for a wedding dress.

title.children: Woman told fiance's mother Kurtley Beale 'could hardly stand up', 'won't remember' alleged sexual assault, court told

image.altText: A man wearing a crumpled blue shirt looks down.

props.synopsis: Nicholas Visser first contacted the girl on the social media app Snapchat, then told an internal school investigation the friend request was a mistake he made after a night of drinking.

title.children: WA school teacher jailed for sexual abuse of teenage student after messaging on Snapchat

image.altText: A split image showing a smiling, blonde woman in a formal dress. She is also shown near a car in a driveway.

props.synopsis: Police and SES personnel are searchingÂ an area of state forest near the Victorian city in search of the missing 51-year-old.

title.children: Concerns grow for Ballarat woman last seen leaving for morning run

image.altText: Tasmania Police scene tape, generic image.

props.synopsis: A young Tasmanian man who accused his then-girlfriend of cheating on him, then subjected her to 48 hours of horrific abuse, is sentenced to a decade in prison.

title.children: Woman's horrific ordeal at hands of 20yo man detailed as he is sentenced to a decade in prison

image.altText: People including a man using a wheelchair near a makeshift tent

props.synopsis: A housing summit addressing intergenerational equity has been held in Sydney, as a report foundÂ less than half of the children born in the city today will ever own a home.

title.children: San Francisco 'wiped out' the middle class. Sydney needs to 'act now' to ensure housing equity, NSW treasurer says

image.altText: The sun rises over flooded channels in outback Queensland.

props.synopsis: In any other situation, floodwaters spanning 6 kilometres would be a cause for alarm, but in the Channel Country, it is a welcome sight.

title.children: Flooding in outback Queensland a 'godsend' for grazier who has missed the rain
